   19: 
   20: -module(bs_match_int_no_opt_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24: 	 integer/1,mixed_sizes/1,signed_integer/1,dynamic/1,more_dynamic/1,
   25:          mml/1,match_huge_int/1,bignum/1,unaligned_32_bit/1,unit/1]).
   26: 
   27: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   28: 
   29: -import(lists, [seq/2]).
   30: 
   31: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   32: 
   33: all() ->
   34:     [integer, mixed_sizes, signed_integer, dynamic, more_dynamic, mml,
   35:      match_huge_int, bignum, unaligned_32_bit, unit].
   36: 
   37: groups() ->
   38:     [].
   39: 
   40: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   41:     Config.
   42: 
   43: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   44:     ok.
   45: 
   46: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   47:     Config.
   48: 
   49: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   50:     Config.
   51: 
   52: 
   53: integer(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   54:     _ = rand:uniform(),				%Seed generator
   55:     io:format("Seed: ~p", [rand:export_seed()]),
   56: 
   57:     0 = get_int(mkbin([])),
   58:     0 = get_int(mkbin([0])),
   59:     42 = get_int(mkbin([42])),
   60:     255 = get_int(mkbin([255])),
   61:     256 = get_int(mkbin([1,0])),
   62:     257 = get_int(mkbin([1,1])),
   63:     258 = get_int(mkbin([1,2])),
   64:     65534 = get_int(mkbin([255,254])),
   65:     16776455 = get_int(mkbin([255,253,7])),
   66:     4245492555 = get_int(mkbin([253,13,19,75])),
   67:     4294967294 = get_int(mkbin([255,255,255,254])),
   68:     4294967295 = get_int(mkbin([255,255,255,255])),
   69: 
   70:     16#cafebeef = get_int(<<16#cafebeef:32>>),
   71:     16#cafebeef42 = get_int(<<16#cafebeef42:40>>),
   72:     16#cafebeeffeed = get_int(<<16#cafebeeffeed:48>>),
   73:     16#cafebeeffeed42 = get_int(<<16#cafebeeffeed42:56>>),
   74:     16#1cafebeeffeed42 = get_int(<<16#1cafebeeffeed42:57>>),
   75:     16#2cafebeeffeed42 = get_int(<<16#2cafebeeffeed42:58>>),
   76:     16#7cafebeeffeed42 = get_int(<<16#7cafebeeffeed42:59>>),
   77: 
   78:     16#beefcafefeed = get_int(<<16#beefcafefeed:60>>),
   79:     16#beefcafefeed = get_int(<<16#beefcafefeed:61>>),
   80:     16#beefcafefeed = get_int(<<16#beefcafefeed:62>>),
   81:     16#beefcafefeed = get_int(<<16#beefcafefeed:63>>),
   82: 
   83:     16#cafebeeffeed42 = get_int(<<16#cafebeeffeed42:60>>),
   84:     16#cafebeeffeed42 = get_int(<<16#cafebeeffeed42:61>>),
   85:     16#cafebeeffeed42 = get_int(<<16#cafebeeffeed42:62>>),
   86:     16#cafebeeffeed42 = get_int(<<16#cafebeeffeed42:63>>),
   87: 
   88:     16#acafebeeffeed42 = get_int(<<16#acafebeeffeed42:60>>),
   89:     16#acafebeeffeed42 = get_int(<<16#acafebeeffeed42:61>>),
   90:     16#acafebeeffeed42 = get_int(<<16#acafebeeffeed42:62>>),
   91:     16#acafebeeffeed42 = get_int(<<16#acafebeeffeed42:63>>),
   92: 
   93:     16#cafebeeffeed = get_int(<<16#cafebeeffeed:64>>),
   94:     16#cafebeeffeedface = get_int(<<16#cafebeeffeedface:64>>),
   95: 
   96:     get_int_roundtrip(rand:bytes(12), 0),
   97:     get_int_roundtrip(rand:bytes(12), 0),
   98: 
   99:     Eight = [200,1,19,128,222,42,97,111],
  100:     cmp128(Eight, uint(Eight)),
  101:     fun_clause(catch get_int(mkbin(seq(1, 20)))),
  102:     ok.
  103: 
  104: get_int_roundtrip(Bin0, Size) when Size =< 8*byte_size(Bin0) ->
  105:     <<Bin:Size/bits,_/bits>> = Bin0,
  106:     <<I:Size>> = Bin,
  107:     I = get_int(Bin),
  108:     get_int_roundtrip(Bin0, Size+1);
  109: get_int_roundtrip(_, _) -> ok.
  110: 
  111: get_int(Bin0) ->
  112:     %% Note that it has become impossible to create a byte-sized sub
  113:     %% binary (see erts_build_sub_bitstring() in erl_bits.c) of size 64
  114:     %% or less. Therefore, to be able to create an unaligned binary,
  115:     %% we'll need to base it on a binary with more than 64 bytes.
  116:     Size = bit_size(Bin0),
  117:     Filler = rand:bytes(65),
  118:     UnsignedBigBin = id(<<Filler/binary,Bin0/bits>>),
  119:     I = get_unsigned_big(UnsignedBigBin),
  120: 
  121:     %% io:format("~p ~p\n", [Size,I]),
  122:     if
  123:         Size =< 10*8 ->
  124:             OversizedUnsignedBig = id(<<Filler/binary,0:16,Bin0/bits>>),
  125:             I = get_unsigned_big(OversizedUnsignedBig);
  126:         true ->
  127:             ok
  128:     end,
  129: 
  130:     test_unaligned(UnsignedBigBin, I, fun get_unsigned_big/1),
  131: 
  132:     %% Test unsigned little-endian integers.
  133: 
  134:     UnsignedLittleBin = id(<<Filler/binary,I:Size/little>>),
  135:     I = get_unsigned_little(UnsignedLittleBin),
  136: 
  137:     test_unaligned(UnsignedLittleBin, I, fun get_unsigned_little/1),
  138: 
  139:     %% Test signed big-endian integers.
  140: 
  141:     SignedBigBin1 = id(<<Filler/binary,(-I):(Size+1)/big>>),
  142:     I = -get_signed_big(SignedBigBin1),
  143: 
  144:     SignedBigBin2 = id(<<Filler/binary,I:(Size+1)/big>>),
  145:     I = get_signed_big(SignedBigBin2),
  146: 
  147:     %% test_unaligned(SignedBigBin1, -I, fun get_signed_big/1),
  148:     test_unaligned(SignedBigBin2, I, fun get_signed_big/1),
  149: 
  150:     %% Test signed little-endian integers.
  151: 
  152:     SignedLittleBin1 = id(<<Filler/binary,(-I):(Size+1)/little>>),
  153:     I = -get_signed_little(SignedLittleBin1),
  154: 
  155:     SignedLittleBin2 = id(<<Filler/binary,I:(Size+1)/little>>),
  156:     I = get_signed_little(SignedLittleBin2),
  157: 
  158:     test_unaligned(SignedLittleBin1, -I, fun get_signed_little/1),
  159:     test_unaligned(SignedLittleBin2, I, fun get_signed_little/1),
  160: 
  161:     I.
  162: 
  163: test_unaligned(Bin, I, Matcher) ->
  164:     <<RandBytes1:8/binary,RandBytes2:8/binary>> = rand:bytes(16),
  165:     Size = bit_size(Bin),
  166:     _ = [begin
  167:              <<_:(Offset+32),UnalignedBin:Size/bits,_/bits>> =
  168:                  id(<<RandBytes1:(Offset+32)/bits,
  169:                       Bin:Size/bits,
  170:                       RandBytes2/binary>>),
  171:              I = Matcher(UnalignedBin)
  172:          end || Offset <- [1,2,3,4,5,6,7]],
  173:     ok.
  174: 
  175: 
  176: 
  177: get_unsigned_big(Bin) ->
  178:     Res = get_unsigned_big_plain(Bin),
  179:     [A,B,C,D,E] = id([1,2,3,4,5]),
  180:     {Res,_} = get_unsigned_big_memory_ctx(A, B, C, D, E, Res, Bin),
  181:     Res.
  182: 
  183: get_unsigned_big_memory_ctx(A, B, C, D, E, Res0, Bin) ->
  184:     %% The match context will be in {x,6}, which is not
  185:     %% a X register backed by a CPU register on any platform.
  186:     Res = case Bin of
  187:               <<_:65/unit:8,I:7>> -> I;
  188:               <<_:65/unit:8,I:8>> -> I;
  189:               <<_:65/unit:8,I:36>> -> I;
  190:               <<_:65/unit:8,I:59>> -> I;
  191:               <<_:65/unit:8,I:60>> -> I;
  192:               <<_:65/unit:8,I:61>> -> I;
  193:               <<_:65/unit:8,I:62>> -> I;
  194:               <<_:65/unit:8,I:63>> -> I;
  195:               <<_:65/unit:8,I:64>> -> I;
  196:               <<_:65/unit:8,I:65>> -> I;
  197:               <<_:65/unit:8,I:70>> -> I;
  198:               <<_:65/unit:8,I:80>> -> I;
  199:               <<_:65/unit:8,I:95>> -> I;
  200:               _ -> Res0
  201:           end,
  202:     {Res,{A,B,C,D,E}}.
  203: 
  204: get_unsigned_big_plain(<<_:65/unit:8,I:0>>) -> I;
  205: get_unsigned_big_plain(<<_:65/unit:8,I:1>>) -> I;
  206: get_unsigned_big_plain(<<_:65/unit:8,I:2>>) -> I;

  656:           end),
  657: 
  658:     mixed({5,9,38759385,93},
  659:           fun({A,B,C,D}) ->
  660:                   <<1:3,A:4,B:5,C:47,D:7>>;
  661:              (<<1:3,A:4,B:5,C:47,D:7>>) ->
  662:                   {A,B,C,D}
  663:           end),
  664: 
  665:     mixed({2022,8,22},
  666:           fun({A,B,C}) ->
  667:                   <<A:16/little,B,C>>;
  668:              (<<A:16/little,B,C>>) ->
  669:                   {A,B,C}
  670:           end),
  671: 
  672:     mixed({2022,8,22},
  673:           fun({A,B,C}) ->
  674:                   <<A:16/little,B,C>>;
  675:              (<<A:16/little,B,C>>) ->
  676:                   _ = id(0),
  677:                   {A,B,C}
  678:           end),
  679:     ok.
  680: 
  681: mixed(Data, F) ->
  682:     Bin = F(Data),
  683:     Data = F(Bin),
  684:     true = is_bitstring(Bin).
  685: 
  686: signed_integer(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  687:     {no_match,_} = sint(mkbin([])),
  688:     {no_match,_} = sint(mkbin([1,2,3])),
  689:     127 = sint(mkbin([127])),
  690:     -1 = sint(mkbin([255])),
  691:     -128 = sint(mkbin([128])),
  692:     42 = sint(mkbin([42,255])),
  693:     127 = sint(mkbin([127,255])).
  694: 
  695: sint(Bin) ->
  696:     case Bin of
  697: 	<<I:8/signed>> -> I;
  698: 	<<I:8/signed,_:3,_:5>> -> I;
  699: 	Other -> {no_match,Other}
  700:     end.
  701: 
  702: uint(L) -> uint(L, 0).
  703: uint([H|T], Acc) -> uint(T, Acc bsl 8 bor H);
  704: uint([], Acc) -> Acc.
  705: 
  706: dynamic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  707:     dynamic(mkbin([255]), 8),
  708:     dynamic(mkbin([255,255]), 16),
  709:     dynamic(mkbin([255,255,255]), 24),
  710:     dynamic(mkbin([255,255,255,255]), 32),
  711:     ok.
  712: 
  713: dynamic(Bin, S1) when S1 >= 0 ->
  714:     S2 = size(Bin) * 8 - S1,
  715:     dynamic(Bin, S1, S2, (1 bsl S1) - 1, (1 bsl S2) - 1),
  716:     dynamic(Bin, S1-1);
  717: dynamic(_, _) -> ok.
  718: 
  719: dynamic(Bin, S1, S2, A, B) ->
  720: %    io:format("~p ~p ~p ~p\n", [S1,S2,A,B]),
  721:     case Bin of
  722: 	<<A:S1,B:S2>> ->
  723: 	    io:format("~p ~p ~p ~p\n", [S1,S2,A,B]),
  724: 	    ok;
  725: 	_Other -> erlang:error(badmatch, [Bin,S1,S2,A,B])
  726:     end.
  727: 
  728: %% Extract integers at different alignments and of different sizes.
  729: more_dynamic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  730: 
  731:     %% Unsigned big-endian numbers.
  732:     Unsigned  = fun(Bin, List, SkipBef, N) ->
  733: 			SkipAft = 8*size(Bin) - N - SkipBef,
  734: 			<<_:SkipBef,Int:N,_:SkipAft>> = Bin,
  735: 			Int = make_int(List, N, 0)
  736: 		end,
  737:     more_dynamic1(Unsigned, erlang:md5(mkbin([42]))),
  738: 
  739:     %% Signed big-endian numbers.
  740:     Signed  = fun(Bin, List, SkipBef, N) ->
  741: 		      SkipAft = 8*size(Bin) - N - SkipBef,
  742: 		      <<_:SkipBef,Int:N/signed,_:SkipAft>> = Bin,
  743: 		      case make_signed_int(List, N) of
  744: 			  Int -> ok;
  745: 			  Other ->
  746: 			      io:format("Bin = ~p,", [Bin]),
  747: 			      io:format("SkipBef = ~p, N = ~p", [SkipBef,N]),
  748: 			      io:format("Expected ~p, got ~p", [Int,Other]),
  749: 			      ct:fail(signed_big_endian_fail)
  750: 		      end
  751: 	      end,
  752:     more_dynamic1(Signed, erlang:md5(mkbin([43]))),
  753: 
  754:     %% Unsigned little-endian numbers.
  755:     UnsLittle  = fun(Bin, List, SkipBef, N) ->
  756: 			 SkipAft = 8*size(Bin) - N - SkipBef,
  757: 			 <<_:SkipBef,Int:N/little,_:SkipAft>> = Bin,
  758: 			 Int = make_int(big_to_little(List, N), N, 0)
  759: 		 end,
  760:     more_dynamic1(UnsLittle, erlang:md5(mkbin([44]))),
  761: 
  762:     %% Signed little-endian numbers.
  763:     SignLittle  = fun(Bin, List, SkipBef, N) ->
  764: 			  SkipAft = 8*size(Bin) - N - SkipBef,
  765: 			  <<_:SkipBef,Int:N/signed-little,_:SkipAft>> = Bin,
  766: 			  Little = big_to_little(List, N),
  767: 			  Int = make_signed_int(Little, N)
  768: 		  end,
  769:     more_dynamic1(SignLittle, erlang:md5(mkbin([45]))),
  770: 
  771:     ok.
  772: 
  773: more_dynamic1(Action, Bin) ->
  774:     BitList = bits_to_list(binary_to_list(Bin), 16#80),
  775:     more_dynamic2(Action, Bin, BitList, 0).
  776: 
  777: more_dynamic2(Action, Bin, [_|T]=List, Bef) ->
  778:     more_dynamic3(Action, Bin, List, Bef, size(Bin)*8),
  779:     more_dynamic2(Action, Bin, T, Bef+1);
  780: more_dynamic2(_, _, [], _) -> ok.
  781: 
  782: more_dynamic3(Action, Bin, List, Bef, Aft) when Bef =< Aft ->
  783: %%    io:format("~p, ~p", [Bef,Aft-Bef]),
  784:     Action(Bin, List, Bef, Aft-Bef),
  785:     more_dynamic3(Action, Bin, List, Bef, Aft-1);
  786: more_dynamic3(_, _, _, _, _) -> ok.
  787: 
  788: big_to_little(List, N) -> big_to_little(List, N, []).
  789: 
  790: big_to_little([B0,B1,B2,B3,B4,B5,B6,B7|T], N, Acc) when N >= 8 ->
  791:     big_to_little(T, N-8, [B0,B1,B2,B3,B4,B5,B6,B7|Acc]);
  792: big_to_little(List, N, Acc) -> lists:sublist(List, 1, N) ++ Acc.
  793: 
  794: make_signed_int(_List, 0) -> 0;
  795: make_signed_int([0|_]=List, N) -> make_int(List, N, 0);
  796: make_signed_int([1|_]=List0, N) ->
  797:     List1 = reversed_sublist(List0, N, []),
  798:     List2 = two_complement_and_reverse(List1, 1, []),
  799:     -make_int(List2, length(List2), 0).
  800: 
  801: reversed_sublist(_List, 0, Acc) -> Acc;
  802: reversed_sublist([H|T], N, Acc) -> reversed_sublist(T, N-1, [H|Acc]).
  803:     
  804: two_complement_and_reverse([H|T], Carry, Acc) ->
  805:     Sum = 1-H+Carry,
  806:     two_complement_and_reverse(T, Sum div 2, [Sum rem 2|Acc]);
  807: two_complement_and_reverse([], Carry, Acc) -> [Carry|Acc].
  808: 
  809: make_int(_List, 0, Acc) -> Acc;
  810: make_int([H|T], N, Acc) -> make_int(T, N-1, Acc bsl 1 bor H).
  811:     
  812: bits_to_list([_|T], 0) -> bits_to_list(T, 16#80);
  813: bits_to_list([H|_]=List, Mask) ->
  814:     [case H band Mask of
  815: 	 0 -> 0;
  816: 	 _ -> 1
  817:      end|bits_to_list(List, Mask bsr 1)];
  818: bits_to_list([], _) -> [].
  819: 
  820: fun_clause({'EXIT',{function_clause,_}}) -> ok.
  821: mkbin(L) when is_list(L) -> list_to_binary(L).
  822:     
  823: 
  824: mml(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  825:     single_byte_binary = mml_choose(<<42>>),
  826:     multi_byte_binary = mml_choose(<<42,43>>).
  827: 
  828: mml_choose(<<_A:8>>) -> single_byte_binary;
  829: mml_choose(<<_A:8,_T/binary>>) -> multi_byte_binary.
  830: 
  831: match_huge_int(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  832:     case ?MODULE of
  833:         bs_match_int_no_opt_SUITE ->
  834:             %% This test case is written with the assumption that
  835:             %% bs_skip2 instructions are used when the value of the
  836:             %% extracted segment will not be used. In OTP 21 and earlier, that
  837:             %% assumption was always true, because the bs_skip optimization
  838:             %% was included in v3_codegen and could not be disabled.
  839:             %% In OTP 22, the bs_skip optimization is done by beam_ssa_opt
  840:             %% and is disabled.
  841:             %%
  842:             %% On memory-constrained computers, using bs_get_integer2
  843:             %% instructions may cause the runtime system to terminate
  844:             %% because of insufficient memory.
  845:             {skip, "unoptimized code would use too much memory"};
  846:         bs_match_int_SUITE ->
  847:             do_match_huge_int();
  848:         bs_match_int_r25_SUITE ->
  849:             do_match_huge_int();
  850:         bs_match_int_stripped_types_SUITE ->
  851:             do_match_huge_int()
  852:     end.
  853: 
  854: do_match_huge_int() ->
  855:     Sz = 1 bsl 27,
  856:     Bin = <<0:Sz,13:8>>,
  857:     skip_huge_int_1(Sz, Bin),
  858:     0 = match_huge_int_1(Sz, Bin),
  859: 
  860:     %% Test overflowing the size of an integer field.
  861:     nomatch = overflow_huge_int_skip_32(Bin),
  862:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  863:         4 ->
  864:             nomatch = overflow_huge_int_32(Bin);
  865:         8 ->
  866:             %% An attempt will be made to allocate heap space for
  867:             %% the bignum (which will probably fail); only if the
  868:             %% allocation succeeds will the matching fail because
  869:             %% the binary is too small.
  870:             ok
  871:     end,
  872:     nomatch = overflow_huge_int_skip_64(Bin),
  873:     nomatch = overflow_huge_int_64(Bin),
  874: 
  875:     %% Test overflowing the size of an integer field using
  876:     %% variables as sizes.
  877:     Sizes = case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  878:                 4 -> lists:seq(25, 32);
  879:                 8 -> []
  880:             end ++ lists:seq(50, 64),
  881:     ok = overflow_huge_int_unit128(Bin, Sizes),
  882: 
  883:     %% GH-6701: [vm] crash with -emu_flavor emu:
  884:     %% "no next heap size found: 18446744072702918678, offset 0"
  885:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} =
  886:         (catch fun(<<X:2147483647/unit:98>>) -> X end(<<>>)),
  887:     ok.
  888: 
  889: overflow_huge_int_unit128(Bin, [Sz0|Sizes]) ->
  890:     Sz = id(1 bsl Sz0),
  891:     case Bin of
  892: 	<<_:Sz/unit:128,0,_/binary>> ->
  893: 	    {error,Sz};
  894: 	_ ->
  895: 	    case Bin of
  896: 		<<Var:Sz/unit:128,0,_/binary>> ->
  897: 		    {error,Sz,Var};
  898: 		_ ->
  899: 		    overflow_huge_int_unit128(Bin, Sizes)
  900: 	    end
  901:     end;
  902: overflow_huge_int_unit128(_, []) -> ok.
  903: 
  904: match_huge_int_1(I, Bin) ->
  905:     <<Int:I,13>> = Bin,
  906:     Int.
  907: 
  908: skip_huge_int_1(I, Bin) ->
  909:     <<_:I,13>> = Bin.
  910: 
  911: overflow_huge_int_skip_32(<<_:4294967296,0,_/binary>>) -> 1; % 1 bsl 32
  912: overflow_huge_int_skip_32(<<_:33554432/unit:128,0,_/binary>>) -> 2; % 1 bsl 25
  913: overflow_huge_int_skip_32(<<_:67108864/unit:64,0,_/binary>>) -> 3; % 1 bsl 26
  914: overflow_huge_int_skip_32(<<_:134217728/unit:32,0,_/binary>>) -> 4; % 1 bsl 27
  915: overflow_huge_int_skip_32(<<_:268435456/unit:16,0,_/binary>>) -> 5; % 1 bsl 28
  916: overflow_huge_int_skip_32(<<_:536870912/unit:8,0,_/binary>>) -> 6; % 1 bsl 29
  917: overflow_huge_int_skip_32(<<_:1073741824/unit:8,0,_/binary>>) -> 7; % 1 bsl 30
  918: overflow_huge_int_skip_32(<<_:2147483648/unit:8,0,_/binary>>) -> 8; % 1 bsl 31
  919: overflow_huge_int_skip_32(_) -> nomatch.
  920: 
  921: overflow_huge_int_32(<<Int:4294967296,_/binary>>) -> {1,Int}; % 1 bsl 32
  922: overflow_huge_int_32(<<Int:33554432/unit:128,0,_/binary>>) -> {2,Int}; % 1 bsl 25
  923: overflow_huge_int_32(<<Int:67108864/unit:128,0,_/binary>>) -> {3,Int}; % 1 bsl 26
  924: overflow_huge_int_32(<<Int:134217728/unit:128,0,_/binary>>) -> {4,Int}; % 1 bsl 27
  925: overflow_huge_int_32(<<Int:268435456/unit:128,0,_/binary>>) -> {5,Int}; % 1 bsl 28
  926: overflow_huge_int_32(<<Int:536870912/unit:128,0,_/binary>>) -> {6,Int}; % 1 bsl 29
  927: overflow_huge_int_32(<<Int:1073741824/unit:128,0,_/binary>>) -> {7,Int}; % 1 bsl 30
  928: overflow_huge_int_32(<<Int:2147483648/unit:128,0,_/binary>>) -> {8,Int}; % 1 bsl 31
  929: overflow_huge_int_32(_) -> nomatch.
  930: 
  931: overflow_huge_int_skip_64(<<_:18446744073709551616,_/binary>>) -> 1; % 1 bsl 64
  932: overflow_huge_int_skip_64(<<_:144115188075855872/unit:128,0,_/binary>>) -> 2; % 1 bsl 57
  933: overflow_huge_int_skip_64(<<_:288230376151711744/unit:64,0,_/binary>>) -> 3; % 1 bsl 58
  934: overflow_huge_int_skip_64(<<_:576460752303423488/unit:32,0,_/binary>>) -> 4; % 1 bsl 59
  935: overflow_huge_int_skip_64(<<_:1152921504606846976/unit:16,0,_/binary>>) -> 5; % 1 bsl 60
  936: overflow_huge_int_skip_64(<<_:2305843009213693952/unit:8,0,_/binary>>) -> 6; % 1 bsl 61
  937: overflow_huge_int_skip_64(<<_:4611686018427387904/unit:8,0,_/binary>>) -> 7; % 1 bsl 62
  938: overflow_huge_int_skip_64(<<_:9223372036854775808/unit:8,0,_/binary>>) -> 8; % 1 bsl 63
  939: overflow_huge_int_skip_64(_) -> nomatch.
  940: 
  941: overflow_huge_int_64(<<Int:18446744073709551616,_/binary>>) -> {1,Int}; % 1 bsl 64
  942: overflow_huge_int_64(<<Int:144115188075855872/unit:128,0,_/binary>>) -> {2,Int}; % 1 bsl 57
  943: overflow_huge_int_64(<<Int:288230376151711744/unit:128,0,_/binary>>) -> {3,Int}; % 1 bsl 58
  944: overflow_huge_int_64(<<Int:576460752303423488/unit:128,0,_/binary>>) -> {4,Int}; % 1 bsl 59
  945: overflow_huge_int_64(<<Int:1152921504606846976/unit:128,0,_/binary>>) -> {5,Int}; % 1 bsl 60
  946: overflow_huge_int_64(<<Int:2305843009213693952/unit:128,0,_/binary>>) -> {6,Int}; % 1 bsl 61
  947: overflow_huge_int_64(<<Int:4611686018427387904/unit:128,0,_/binary>>) -> {7,Int}; % 1 bsl 62
  948: overflow_huge_int_64(<<Int:9223372036854775808/unit:128,0,_/binary>>) -> {8,Int}; % 1 bsl 63
  949: overflow_huge_int_64(_) -> nomatch.
  950: 
  951: bignum(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  952:     Bin = id(<<42,0:1024/unit:8,43>>),
  953:     <<42:1025/little-integer-unit:8,_:8>> = Bin,
  954:     <<_:8,43:1025/integer-unit:8>> = Bin,
  955: 
  956:     BignumBin = id(<<0:512/unit:8,258254417031933722623:9/unit:8>>),
  957:     <<258254417031933722623:(512+9)/unit:8>> = BignumBin,
  958:     erlang:garbage_collect(),			%Search for holes in debug-build
  959: 
  960:     %% ERL-1391
  961:    _ =  [begin
  962:             N = (LHS bsl RHS),
  963:             <<N:64/integer-little-signed>> = id(<<N:64/integer-little-signed>>)
  964:          end || LHS <- [-1, 1], RHS <- lists:seq(1, 62)],
  965: 
  966:     MPos = (1 bsl 63) - 1,
  967:     <<MPos:64/integer-little-signed>> = id(<<MPos:64/integer-little-signed>>),
  968:     MNeg = -1 bsl 63,
  969:     <<MNeg:64/integer-little-signed>> = id(<<MNeg:64/integer-little-signed>>),
  970: 
  971:     ok.
  972: 
  973: unaligned_32_bit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  974:     %% There used to be a risk for heap overflow (fixed in R11B-5).
  975:     L = unaligned_32_bit_1(<<-1:(64*1024)>>),
  976:     unaligned_32_bit_verify(L, 1638).
  977: 
  978: unaligned_32_bit_1(<<1:1,U:32,_:7,T/binary>>) ->
  979:     [U|unaligned_32_bit_1(T)];
  980: unaligned_32_bit_1(_) ->
  981:     [].
  982: 
  983: unaligned_32_bit_verify([], 0) -> ok;
  984: unaligned_32_bit_verify([4294967295|T], N) when N > 0 ->
  985:     unaligned_32_bit_verify(T, N-1).
  986: 
  987: unit(_Config) ->
  988:     %% GH-6732. Would fail to match with no_ssa_opt or r25.
  989:     <<V1:5/integer-unit:8>> = id(<<16#cafebeef:5/integer-unit:8>>),
  990:     16#cafebeef = id(V1),
  991:     <<V2:8/integer-unit:5>> = id(<<16#cafebeef:8/integer-unit:5>>),
  992:     16#cafebeef = id(V2),
  993: 
  994:     ok.
  995: 
  996: %%%
  997: %%% Common utilities.
  998: %%%
  999: 
 1000: id(I) -> I.
